description:
The Dems are the party of the rich and by the rich, as they slap the working class into oblivion.

So, while the left may have once been seen as the party of the people, that is no longer the case, as it’s clear to anyone with a fraction of a brain that their intent is not to represent the American people. This is why the Dems went from having a 25-point lead on this issue to now being tied with Republicans, and if the trend continues, they will soon be behind.

A shocker for me given the tariff war: The GOP seems to be in their best position ever for the party who cares more for the needs of people like yourself.
title: CNN is near speechless over data showing Donald Trump cares more about Americans than the Democrats do: "A shocker"

description:
Rep. Jasmine Crockett appeared on MSNBC's "All In with Chris Hayes" to compare the Trump Administration and the SCOTUS to an “abusive relationship” and ignored the fact that the left has abused the American people for far too long.

Rep Jasmine Crockett Says She's In An Abusive Relationship With Trump Administration

"I feel like I'm in an abusive relationship. I think all Americans may feel like we're in an abusive relationship with this Administration as well as with the Supreme Court."… pic.twitter.com/aNyW8CrAoy
— Mr Producer (@RichSementa) April 11, 2025
title: Jasmine Crockett makes scandalous claims she is in an abusive relationship... with Donald Trump

description:
Over the last couple of months, Democratic Rep. Jahana Hayes has considered her vote in favor of the Laken Riley Act, which was passed in January. She regrets this deeply and wishes she had voted differently.

If you needed any more evidence that the majority of Democrats are all in it to protect criminal aliens over Americans, here it is:

🚨Dem Rep Jahana Hayes says she REGRETS voting for the Laken Riley Act.

21% and falling. pic.twitter.com/pi8gDRCogy
— Western Lensman (@WesternLensman) April 11, 2025

Do you n
title: Democrat has a change of (no) heart, now swears she REGRETS voting for the Laken Riley Act
